Package ohos.agp.window.dialog

Class ListDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.window.dialog.BaseDialog
      • ohos.agp.window.dialog.CommonDialog
        • ohos.agp.window.dialog.ListDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDialog

    public class ListDialog
extends CommonDialog
    Creates a ListDialog instance.

    A list dialog box includes the radio box list and check box list.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Field Detail

      • MULTI

        public static final int MULTI
        Indicates a check box list.

        This value indicates a list with check boxes.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NORMAL

        public static final int NORMAL
        Indicates a common list.

        This value distinguishes the list from the list with a radio box..

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SINGLE

        public static final int SINGLE
        Indicates a radio box list.

        This value indicates a list with a radio box..

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • ListDialog

        public ListDialog​(Context context)
        A constructor used to create a ListDialog instance of the common type.

        A common list is used.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the ohos context.

      • ListDialog

        public ListDialog​(Context context,
                  int type)
        A constructor used to create a ListDialog instance.

        Currently, a ListDialog instance supports three attributes: radio box, check box, and common list.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the ohos context.
        type - Indicates the list type, which can be the radio box, check box, or common.

    • Method Detail

      • setOnSingleSelectListener

        public void setOnSingleSelectListener​(IDialog.ClickedListener listener)
        Registers a listener for common lists or radio box lists.

        This method can be used for the common and radio box lists.

        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener to register.

      • setOnMultiSelectListener

        public void setOnMultiSelectListener​(IDialog.CheckBoxClickedListener listener)
        Registers a listener for check box lists.

        This method can be used for the check box lists.

        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener to register.

      • addItem

        public ListDialog addItem​(String item)
        Adds an item to a ListDialog instance.
        Parameters:
        item - Indicates the item to add.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setItems(items).show().

      • removeItem

        public ListDialog removeItem​(String item)
        Removes an item from a ListDialog instance.
        Parameters:
        item - Indicates the item to remove.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setItems(items).show().

      • setItems

        public ListDialog setItems​(String[] items)
        Sets the items to be displayed in a list.

        This method applies to common lists.

        Parameters:
        items - Indicates the items to be displayed in a list.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setItems(items).show().

      • setSingleSelectItems

        public ListDialog setSingleSelectItems​(String[] items,
                                       int selectedId)
        Sets the items to be displayed in a radio box list.
        Parameters:
        items - Indicates the items to be displayed in a radio box list.
        selectedId - Indicates the item selected by default.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setItems(items).show().

      • setMultiSelectItems

        public ListDialog setMultiSelectItems​(String[] items,
                                      boolean[] selectedItems)
        Sets the items to be displayed in a check box list.
        Parameters:
        items - Indicates the items to be displayed in a check box list.
        selectedItems - Indicates the items selected by default.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setItems(items).show().

      • setProvider

        public void setProvider​(BaseItemProvider provider)
        Sets a specified provider for this list dialog box.
        Parameters:
        provider - Indicates the provider to set. The provider allows access to the list data and creates a component for each piece of data.
        Since:
        4

      • setListener

        public void setListener​(ListContainer.ItemClickedListener clickListener,
                        ListContainer.ItemLongClickedListener longClicklistener,
                        ListContainer.ItemSelectedListener selectedlistener)
        Sets a user-defined listener for the events of an item.
        Parameters:
        clickListener - Indicates the listener for click events of the item.
        longClicklistener - Indicates the listener for long click events of the item.
        selectedlistener - Indicates the listener for selected events of the item.

        Sets the background color of a list.
        Parameters:
        color - Indicates the user-defined background color.

      • getItemComponent

        public Component getItemComponent​(int position)
        Obtains the component matching the item at a specified position.
        Parameters:
        position - Indicates the position specified by the user.
        Returns:
        Returns the Component, or null if the position is out of range.
